availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Womack (Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth W. Womack. Father of Louisa S. Womack, Elizabeth P. Womack Scofield, John C. Womack, Mary A. Womack, Martha H. Womack, and Rosa B. Womack. Married to Lucy Adeline Crenshaw Womack. Stepfather of Amanda Crenshaw Womack. Father of Bettie Womack. Farmer in Halifax County, Virginia, in 1850. Farmer in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Boswells, District 10, p. 273C.
